info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 5:59PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Mesa County through 630 PM MDT... At 559 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Palisade, or 13 miles northeast of Grand Junction, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palisade. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 40 and 56. Colorado 65 between mile markers 54 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
